newsitem.title: CANADA: North and Central America port conditions - Lloyds.
newsitem.headline: North and Central America port conditions - Lloyds.

text.p: Port conditions from Lloyds Shipping Intelligence Service --

CANADA, June 30 - Vancouver, BC - GRAIN - 7 Vessels loading, 11 waiting, 7-10 days delay expected, depending on grade to be loaded. Robert's Bank - COAL - 2 Vessels loading, 4 waiting, 2-3 days delay. 27 Vessels expected in July. Prince Rupert - GRAIN - 1 Vessel loading, 3 waiting, 6-7 days delay, depending on grade to be loaded.

HONDURAS, June 30 - Puerto Cortes - Three vessels berthed of which 2 discharging/loading containers/general, 1 loading scrap. 2 Vessels anchored of which 1 to discharge fertiliser, 1 to discharge wheat. 20 Vessels due of which 1 passenger, 12 to discharge/load containers/generals, 6 to discharge/load containers/bananas, 1 to discharge lubricants. Vessels berthed, 4 discharging/loading containers, 2 discharging fertiliser, 4 waiting berth to discharge/load containers. Vessels due, 5 to discharge bananas, 8 to load/discharge containers, 1 passenger/vehicles, 1 to discharge corn, 1 to discharge paper/load wood.

MEXICO, July 1 - Tampico - Vessels in port, 4 steel coils, 3 general cargo, 1 cement, 2 minerals, 2 grain, working normally. Altamira - Vessels in port, 2 containers, 2 chemicals, 1 fertiliser, working normally. Veracruz - Vessels in port, 3 sugar, 3 pipes, 2 containers, 1 fertiliser, 3 grain, 2 oil tankers, working normally. Manzanillo - Vessels in port, 2 cement, 1 cars, 2 clinker, 3 general cargo, 2 containers, working normally. Coatzacoalcos - Vessels in port, 10 oil tankers, 5 chemicals, working normally.

PANAMA, June 30 - Balboa, Cristobal - Working normally. Panama Canal - Waterway operating at full capacity until 7/7 when locks lanes outages at Miraflores and Gatun commence, for major maintenance and improvement projects for a period of 13 days, depending on ship arrivals. Delays during this period could be approx. 3 days. 35 Vessels due, 27 in queue, 12 booked, 37 scheduled.

UNITED STATES, June 30 - Hampton Roads, VA - Three general cargo/container vessels in pier operating, 3 bulkers in pier loading coal, 4 anchored waiting to load, 1 bulker loading fertiliser, 1 tanker discharging crude oil, 1 bulker discharging gypsum, 1 bulker loading woodpulp, 1 general cargo loading military cargo, 1 bulker loading grain. 4 Vessels in pier under repairs. Baltimore, MD - Vessels operating in port, 9 bulkers, 3 container vessels, 2 ro-ro, 2 auto vessels, 1 tanker, 3 general cargo, 1 cable vessel on standby. Honolulu, HI - Harbour - 3 Vessels berthed of which 1 container, 1 tanker, 4 tugs and barges, 1 tanker at anchorage. Barbers Point, HI - Two barges berthed. No other reports/information received.
